    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyBindingsAdapter

        public KeyBindingsAdapter()
        Creates a new KeyBindingsAdapter with no current Key Bindings.

      • KeyBindingsAdapter

        public KeyBindingsAdapter(JComponent c,
                          int interval,
                          int... keyCodes)
        Creates a new KeyBindingsAdapter with key bindings mapped to JComponent with key codes and an interval at which key events fire.
        Parameters:
        c - the component that key bindings are mapped to
        interval - the interval at which key events are fired when specified keys are pressed
        keyCodes - integers corresponding to actual keys on the keyboard

    • Method Detail

      • createComboKeyBinding

        public void createComboKeyBinding(JComponent c,
                                  Object key,
                                  int modifiers,
                                  int... keyCodes)
        Maps key binding to JComponent with user-defined object, specified modifiers, and multiple key code arguments that serve as conditions to be met before event is fired. For example if you want A+Enter to do something specific, you would call

        createComboKeyBinding( c, "do something", 0, java.awt.event.KeyEvent.VK_A, java.awt.event.KeyEvent.VK_ENTER)

        then override the comboPressed method to perform your desired task.

        The following are valid arguments for the modifiers parameter

        • java.awt.event.InputEvent.SHIFT_MASK
        • java.awt.event.InputEvent.CTRL_MASK
        • java.awt.event.InputEvent.META_MASK
        • java.awt.event.InputEvent.ALT_MASK

        Likewise, you can use the | bitwise operator to specify any combination of modifiers.

        Parameters:
        c - the component that key bindings are mapped to
        key - a user-defined key for the new combo key binding
        modifiers - a bitwise-ored combination of any modifiers
        keyCodes - integers corresponding to actual keys on the keyboard

      • createKeyBinding

        public void createKeyBinding(JComponent c,
                             int interval,
                             int modifiers,
                             int keyCode)
        Creates a new key bindings mapped to JComponent with key codes and an interval at which key events fire.

        The following are valid arguments for the modifiers parameter

        • java.awt.event.InputEvent.SHIFT_MASK
        • java.awt.event.InputEvent.CTRL_MASK
        • java.awt.event.InputEvent.META_MASK
        • java.awt.event.InputEvent.ALT_MASK

        Likewise, you can use the | bitwise operator to specify any combination of modifiers.

        Parameters:
        c - the component that key bindings are mapped to
        interval - the interval at which key events are fired when specified keys are pressed
        modifiers - a bitwise-ored combination of any modifiers
        keyCode - an integer corresponding to an actual key on the keyboard

      • createKeyBindings

        public void createKeyBindings(JComponent c,
                              int interval,
                              int... keyCodes)
        Creates a new KeyBindingsAdapter with key bindings mapped to JComponent with key codes and an interval at which key events fire.
        Parameters:
        c - the component that key bindings are mapped to
        interval - the interval at which key events are fired when specified keys are pressed
        keyCodes - integers corresponding to actual keys on the keyboard

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
        A method that accepts KeyEvents from the current key bindings when a key has been pressed. See the class description for KeyEvent for a definition of a key pressed event.

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e)
        A method that accepts KeyEvents from the current key bindings when a key has been released. See the class description for KeyEvent for a definition of a key released event.

      • comboPressed

        public void comboPressed(Object key)
        A method that accepts the user-defined key from a combo key binding when a key combination has been pressed.
